abstract: More than 16 million viewers tuned in to “60 Minutes” on Sunday for the veteran newsmagazine’s interview with President Barack Obama, according to Nielsen’s estimates.
snippet: More than 16 million viewers tuned in to “60 Minutes” on Sunday for the veteran newsmagazine’s interview with President Barack Obama, according to Nielsen’s estimates.
lead_paragraph: More than 16 million viewers tuned in to “60 Minutes” on Sunday for the newsmagazine’s interview with President Obama, according to Nielsen’s estimates. The CBS show was delayed nearly an hour from its usual 7 p.m. time slot because of an overrun of the network’s college basketball coverage, which averaged over 15 million viewers during the 7 p.m. hour, the first part of prime time on Sunday.

headline.main: Ratings: ’60 Minutes,’ Featuring Obama Interview, Draws 16 Million
